TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Geocoder extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A class for handling geocoding and reverse geocoding.

remarks.para:
A class for handling geocoding and reverse geocoding. Geocoding is the process of transforming a street address or other description of a location into a (latitude, longitude) coordinate. Reverse geocoding is the process of transforming a (latitude, longitude) coordinate into a (partial) address. The amount of detail in a reverse geocoded location description may vary, for example one might contain the full street address of the closest building, while another might contain only a city name and postal code. The Geocoder class requires a backend service that is not included in the core android framework. The Geocoder query methods will return an empty list if there no backend service in the platform. Use the isPresent() method to determine whether a Geocoder implementation exists.

Warning: Geocoding services may provide no guarantees on availability or accuracy. Results are a best guess, and are not guaranteed to be meaningful or correct. Do not use this API for any safety-critical or regulatory compliance purpose.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.Locations.Address>? GetFromLocation (double latitude, double longitude, int maxResults);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.Locations.Address> GetFromLocation(float64 latitude, float64 longitude, int32 maxResults) cil managed
member this.GetFromLocation : double * double * int -> System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.Locations.Address>

Docs.param: the latitude a point for the search
the longitude a point for the search
max number of addresses to return. Smaller numbers (1 to 5) are recommended
Docs.summary: Returns an array of Addresses that attempt to describe the area immediately surrounding the given latitude and longitude.
Docs.returns: a list of Address objects. Returns null or empty list if no matches were found or there is no backend service available.

remarks.para:
Returns an array of Addresses that attempt to describe the area immediately surrounding the given latitude and longitude. The returned addresses should be localized for the locale provided to this class's constructor.

Warning: Geocoding services may provide no guarantees on availability or accuracy. Results are a best guess, and are not guaranteed to be meaningful or correct. Do NOT use this API for any safety-critical or regulatory compliance purposes.

Warning: This API may hit the network, and may block for excessive amounts of time, up to 60 seconds or more. It's strongly encouraged to use the asynchronous version of this API. If that is not possible, this should be run on a background thread to avoid blocking other operations.
This member is deprecated. Use #getFromLocation(double, double, int, GeocodeListener) instead to avoid blocking a thread waiting for results.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if latitude is less than -90 or greater than 90
if longitude is less than -180 or greater than 180
if the network is unavailable or any other I/O problem occurs

Docs.param: a user-supplied description of a location
max number of results to return. Smaller numbers (1 to 5) are recommended
Docs.summary: Returns an array of Addresses that attempt to describe the named location, which may be a place name such as "Dalvik, Iceland", an address such as "1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA", an airport code such as "SFO", and so forth.
Docs.returns: a list of Address objects. Returns null or empty list if no matches were found or there is no backend service available.

remarks.para:
Returns an array of Addresses that attempt to describe the named location, which may be a place name such as "Dalvik, Iceland", an address such as "1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA", an airport code such as "SFO", and so forth. The returned addresses should be localized for the locale provided to this class's constructor.

Warning: Geocoding services may provide no guarantees on availability or accuracy. Results are a best guess, and are not guaranteed to be meaningful or correct. Do NOT use this API for any safety-critical or regulatory compliance purposes.

MemberSignature.Usage: geocoder.GetFromLocationName (locationName, maxResults, lowerLeftLatitude, lowerLeftLongitude, upperRightLatitude, upperRightLongitude)

Docs.param: a user-supplied description of a location
max number of addresses to return. Smaller numbers (1 to 5) are recommended
the latitude of the lower left corner of the bounding box
the longitude of the lower left corner of the bounding box
the latitude of the upper right corner of the bounding box
the longitude of the upper right corner of the bounding box
Docs.summary: Returns an array of Addresses that attempt to describe the named location, which may be a place name such as "Dalvik, Iceland", an address such as "1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA", an airport code such as "SFO", and so forth.
Docs.returns: a list of Address objects. Returns null or empty list if no matches were found or there is no backend service available.

remarks.para: Returns an array of Addresses that attempt to describe the named location, which may be a place name such as "Dalvik, Iceland", an address such as "1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA", an airport code such as "SFO", and so forth. The returned addresses should be localized for the locale provided to this class's constructor.

You may specify a bounding box for the search results by including the latitude and longitude of the lower left point and upper right point of the box.

Warning: Geocoding services may provide no guarantees on availability or accuracy. Results are a best guess, and are not guaranteed to be meaningful or correct. Do NOT use this API for any safety-critical or regulatory compliance purposes.

Warning: This API may hit the network, and may block for excessive amounts of time, up to 60 seconds or more. It's strongly encouraged to use the asynchronous version of this API. If that is not possible, this should be run on a background thread to avoid blocking other operations.
This member is deprecated. Use #getFromLocationName(String, int, double, double, double, double, GeocodeListener) instead to avoid blocking a thread waiting for results.

Docs.summary: Returns true if there is a geocoder implementation present that may return results.

remarks.para: Returns true if there is a geocoder implementation present that may return results. If true, there is still no guarantee that any individual geocoding attempt will succeed.
